amendment.description: Amendment amends Section 7(a)(7) of the Small Business Act to allow for repayment of SBA 7(a) loans (granted to small businesses after enactment of this bill) to be deferred for a maximum of 12 months from receipt of final loan disbursement if that small business concern is classified in sector 23 of the North American Industry Classification System.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 12 printed in Part B of House Report 111-317 to amend Section 7(a)(7) of the Small Business Act to allow for repayment of SBA 7(A) loans (granted to small businesses after enactment of this bill) to be deferred for a maximum of 12 months from receipt of final loan disbursement if that small business concern is classified in sector 23 of the North American Industry Classification System.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kissell amendment (A012) Agreed to by voice vote.
